ad85acb3-57fe-4c51-88df-153a6c303fb3.description: This certificate badge indicates that the holder has completed the UNC Chapel Hill Coding Boot Camp and has the technical expertise to develop web applications requiring UI, front-end, and back-end skills.
ad85acb3-57fe-4c51-88df-153a6c303fb3.name: Coding Full Stack Boot Camp

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has completed the 24-week Coding Bootcamp from UNC Chapel Hill. Program includes the basics of front-end and back-end technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, React.js. Node.js, Express.js, Database Theory, MySQL, NoSQL (MongoDB), Command Line, and Git.
Between live instructional time, asynchronous material, group projects, and individual assignments, learners spend 450+ hours on program content.

8d2e80ad-5dbd-489e-8d1a-6a03aae805bf.description: This holder has completed the UNC Chapel Hill Digital Marketing Boot Camp and has demonstrated competency with Google Ads for search and display, Google Analytics, Google Keyword Planner, Facebook Ads Manager, Twitter, LinkedIn, and WordPress. They also demonstrated proficiency in creating marketing plans, generating and nurturing leads through all funnel stages, attracting potential customers with targeted content, optimizing websites for organic search, and planning automated campaigns.
8d2e80ad-5dbd-489e-8d1a-6a03aae805bf.name: Digital Marketing Boot Camp

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has completed the 18-week Digital Marketing Boot Camp from UNC Chapel Hill. Program instructional time is 180 hours, and learners spend up to an additional 180 hours on homework and projects.
Developing digital marketing strategies to meet business goals.
Creating and optimizing search, social & display campaigns.
Building target audiences using demographics and affinity audiences.
Identifying brand position and growth opportunities via keyword & competitive research.
Optimizing content and landing pages to improve engagement & conversion rates.
Analyzing and reporting on the success of campaigns against objections & KPIs.
Designing and implementing automated workflows for campaign efficiency.

79da2a10-793b-4ecc-b8a7-1781c71f32b0.description: Earners of the UNC Paralegal badge have a fundamental understanding of comprehensive legal-specific skills. They have demonstrated proficiency through program activities and assessments over the course of approximately 300 hours of study. These earners are certified to sit for the NC Bar Paralegal Certification Exam and are competitively positioned to immediately step into or advance in the Paralegal field.
79da2a10-793b-4ecc-b8a7-1781c71f32b0.name: Paralegal

badge_template_activities.title: Hold a minimum of an associate’s degree from an accredited college/university or international equivalent.
Attend evening and Saturday classes for approximately 10 hours per week for 19 weeks and spend approximately 110 hours on additional study outside of the class time.

Score a minimum of 70% on exams and writing assignments across the class subject areas including (but not limited to) Contracts, Criminal Law, Family Law, Real Estate, Torts and general Paralegal Skills.

3e36967d-a066-4b14-9ad0-c9ef9f77e3d5.description: This certificate badge indicates that the holder has completed the UNC-Chapel Hill Technology Project Management Boot Camp and is prepared to cover all phases of the project life-cycle and deliver results. This project professional is prepared to execute the project management processes by using the appropriate knowledge area tools and techniques to produce the required project artifacts and move the project towards completion. They also demonstrated proficiency in agile/scrum and Jira.
3e36967d-a066-4b14-9ad0-c9ef9f77e3d5.name: Technology Project Management Boot Camp

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has completed the 18-week Technology Project Management Boot Camp from UNC-Chapel Hill. This program includes business of software development, traditional project management, project management in operations, hybrid project management, Agile Methodologies, Scrum Framework, and Jira. Program instructional time is 180 hours, and learners spend up to an additional 180 hours on homework and projects.

2eac58f9-3014-46fd-9bdf-61bab09db09f.description: This certificate badge indicates that the holder has completed the UNC Chapel Hill Data Analytics Boot Camp and has the technical expertise to deliver data analytics solutions that include skills such as data analysis in Excel, Python programming, databases and data integration, and data visualization.
2eac58f9-3014-46fd-9bdf-61bab09db09f.name: Data Analytics Boot Camp

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has completed the 24-week Data Analysis Boot Camp from UNC Chapel Hill. Program includes data analysis and visualization skills and technologies such as intermediate Excel, fundamental statistics, Python programming, API interactions, MySQL, MongoDB, ETL, front-end web visualizations using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, Tableau, big data analytics and machine learning.
Between live instructional time, asynchronous material, group projects, and individual assignments, learners spend 450+ hours on program content.

d164a1c6-e9a2-4b71-9710-138fbda5f9f7.description: The badge earner can identify, understand and build their leadership role in the academy.
d164a1c6-e9a2-4b71-9710-138fbda5f9f7.name: BRIDGES Academic Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a two-month  leadership development program, consisting of 65 hours of synchronous sessions.
Engage in small group sessions,  and panel discussions, learn from industry experts, complete case-study assignments, receive peer feedback and participate in network sessions.
Complete a 360 assessment through the Center for Creative Leadership.

113d1b90-bfa4-41a0-8f72-1c07f8131a24.description: This certificate badge indicates that the holder has completed the UNC Chapel Hill Product Management Boot Camp and is prepared to execute the responsibilities of a product manager. This learner is prepared to guide products through the product life cycle using leading frameworks and techniques to understand user needs and deliver value to customers through innovative product solutions.
113d1b90-bfa4-41a0-8f72-1c07f8131a24.name: Product Management Boot Camp

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has completed the 18-week Product Management Boot Camp from UNC Chapel Hill. The learner has completed over 50 hours of instructor-led sessions, plus 180 hours of reading and homework assignments. The learner has also demonstrated the skills taught in the camp through 11 individual projects and 2 group projects.

043cad2e-0a91-4fcb-8a0a-2e671368b2cd.description: The badge earner has demonstrated they have gone above and beyond Interprofessional Education & Practice at UNC-Chapel Hill. The IPEP Distinguished Scholars Program recognizes excellence and challenges participants to cooperate, coordinate, and collaborate to transform the future of health and human services. While completing the program components, participants reflect on values & ethics of interprofessional practice, roles/responsibilities, interprofessional communication, and teams/teamwork.
043cad2e-0a91-4fcb-8a0a-2e671368b2cd.name: IPEP Distinguished Scholars Program

badge_template_activities.title: Students must enroll in the IPEP Distinguished Scholars Program (IPEP DS) and complete the prerequisite core IPEP work as outlined in their school program. IPEP DS must demonstrate a longitudinal commitment to IPEP of at least two semesters. The two semesters of commitment will include the completion time for the other requirements—membership in a committee, attending events/seminars, an immersion experience, and submission of a of a final reflection assignment.

a24c212c-8390-445c-a801-752e3ed2b1ef.description: The badge earner can: Describe the origins of medical product laws and regulations; Recognize key US and international authorities, organizations, and standards involved in the regulation of medical products; Describe types and subtypes of drugs, biologics, medical devices, and combination products; Summarize critical regulations impacting medical products; Explain how regulatory professionals support medical product development and postmarket compliance in the US and key international markets.
a24c212c-8390-445c-a801-752e3ed2b1ef.name: Micro-Credential in Regulatory Affairs

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 15-week, post-bacalaureate level course on the Fundamentals of Regulatory Affairs consisting of 75 hours of asynchronous e-learning content, supplemental videos and reading assignments, discussion forum prompts, quizzes, and a final exam.

Complete 15 graded quizzes and a graded final exam, and respond to 14 graded discussion forum prompts. Score grade of at least 80% based on a weighting of 50% for quizzes, 25% for the final exam, and 25% for discussion forum prompts.

3db6e29c-452d-47f7-b46d-36cec9555962.description: Badge earner can apply strategies to translate complex information for audiences outside of their own discipline. Badge earner has demonstrated improved effective communication skills through a pre- and post- recording explaining their research/scholarship
3db6e29c-452d-47f7-b46d-36cec9555962.name: Communication Skills for Non-Expert Audiences

badge_template_activities.title: Option A: Complete 8-hour training with Activate to Captivate. Create a pre-and post-training video to demonstrate improved communication skills. Option B: Complete LinkedIn Learning videos related to communication such as: Communicating with Confidence totalling 8 hours. Create a pre-and post-training video to demonstrate improved communication skills. Option C: Complete other communication training of choice. Create a pre-and post-training video to demonstrate improved communication skills.

c426ae11-23b6-4ec5-be97-1e081e4de8ff.description: The badge earner has implemented customer interviews. The badge earner has demonstrated an ability to work with a team to create a prototype. The badge earner has presented a process pitch.
c426ae11-23b6-4ec5-be97-1e081e4de8ff.name: Entrepreneurial Mindset

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 3-day workshop series consisting of 20+ hours of content and hands-on experiential learning. Generate a team presentation.

0255dde4-3480-4437-a348-c6a62ee261b2.description: All UNC-Chapel Hill students interested in enhancing their personal and professional development skills are eligible to participate in the UCS Carolina Career Readiness Certificate. Upon completion, students receive a digital badge and certificate of completion. This Certificate is primarily for students who are looking for work experiences related to their academic major or career goal.
0255dde4-3480-4437-a348-c6a62ee261b2.name: Carolina Career Readiness Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete various self-paced career assessments, attend coaching appointments, and career preparation activities (such as career recruitment or career exploration events hosted by University Career Services or other entities on campus), and document their reflections. They must also attain a work or leadership experience through a micro-internship, a part-time job, a SEED certificate, or an internship credit course, and submit a career and life plan as their final assignment

fe3a1d68-3841-46a9-b1ef-51ef5a9f4996.description: Describe the value of realistic well-defined, achievable, measurable and student centered learning goals. Describe several known high-impact, evidence-based effective instructional practices and materials and recognize their alignment with particular types of learning goals. Describe several assessment techniques and recognize their alignment with particular types of learning goals. Describe the impact of diversity on student learning.
fe3a1d68-3841-46a9-b1ef-51ef5a9f4996.name: CIRTL Associate Level of Accomplishment

badge_template_activities.title: Pedagogical workshops: 5 stand-alone workshops or a workshop series or Departmental pedagogical training course or MOOC: Introduction to Evidence-Based Undergraduate STEM Teaching 2) 1 Diversity training 3) Participation in a learning community (e.g. MOOC learning community, education research journal club, weekly meetings with all course TA’s) 4) Write and submit a teaching statement.

e6e20306-7640-4d8e-89ff-4ad0a93afc7e.description: Canvas Challenge Champions can build a course in Canvas. They have identified the tools & components of Canvas; applied Universal Design for Learning Principles to a course; evaluated a course to determine if Accessibility Guidelines are met; used resources to support diverse learners’ needs; incorporated instructional design practices into their course development; and identified research-based standards (Quality Matters) for quality online/hybrid course design.
e6e20306-7640-4d8e-89ff-4ad0a93afc7e.name: Canvas Challenge Champion

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 7-module, self-paced course fully online on Canvas. Faculty participants participate as learners in a training course, reviewing multimedia content and participating in 7 discussion forums. They also complete 22 assignments in their own Canvas course, practicing what they learn about Canvas' features and course design using their own space. Faculty participants

e67c5c25-0111-400e-a191-052407cc1f73.description: The badge earner has demonstrated an understanding of core competencies needed to provide implementation support and has practiced these competencies with peers engaging in similar work. The badge earner can apply proven tools and strategies to support and sustain implementation and change efforts over time and build trusting relationships among a group of diverse partners.
e67c5c25-0111-400e-a191-052407cc1f73.name: Certificate Program on Implementation Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Complete six-day program grounded in competencies for providing implementation practice, consisting of 24 hours of synchronous content across three courses. Score grade of at least 90% in knowledge assessment following each course. Submit written reflection on opportunities to strengthen competencies for providing implementation support following each course.

c1bbf278-eed6-4260-a6d3-041038bab33e.description: Develop and execute a Teaching-as-Research plan for a limited teaching and learning project, Integrate one or more evidence-based teaching strategies into a teaching plan so as to accomplish learning goals, Implement one or more evidence-based teaching strategies for students in a learning experience, Implement one or more LC strategies for students in a learning experience, Contribute to local professionally-focused learning communities associated with teaching and learning.
c1bbf278-eed6-4260-a6d3-041038bab33e.name: CIRTL Practitioner Level of Accomplishment

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Completion of Associate’s level requirements 2) Teaching experience (guest lecture series, instructor of record) 3) 2 diversity-related workshops/trainings 4) Completion of a TAR project which includes: submission of a TAR project plan, submission of a TAR written report after implementation 5) Participate and/or facilitate/lead a learning community -or- serve on the CIRTL at UNC Chapel Hill Advisory Group 6) Revise and submit teaching statement.

ffe50e11-43dd-477e-b2db-5f6d99470968.description: CIRTL Scholars have added to community knowledge about teaching and learning. They have designed and implemented a Teaching-as-Research investigation, and defended the findings to CIRTL learning-community peers. The significance of CIRTL Scholar Teaching-as-Research work is established through presentation and/or publication of the findings to all-university, regional, national, or international audiences.
ffe50e11-43dd-477e-b2db-5f6d99470968.name: CIRTL Scholar Level of Accomplishment

badge_template_activities.title: 1) Completion of Associate and Practitioner level requirements 2) Presented and/or published the results of rigorous, significant, well-developed Teaching-as-Research and/or education research efforts to national or international audiences of their peers (peer-reviewed projects presented at national conferences and publishing in journals). This level represents a high level of engagement in the pillars of CIRTL through their application and defense of work 3) Update and submit Teaching Statement

2c68cbc7-cb69-4c09-9439-6c613ebb81f8.description: The badger earner has demonstrated the ability to customize their part-time work experience to align with their career goals.
2c68cbc7-cb69-4c09-9439-6c613ebb81f8.name: Professional Internship Experience Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete semester long course in self-paced activities, employer involved experiences, and reflections based off nationally recognized career competencies. Submit Career and Life Plan to reflect on how certificate impacts career future.

skills.name: Career and Self Development Technology skills

5d443501-ad81-498b-a7a9-96cd72ff91db.description: This certificate badge indicates that the holder has completed the UNC Chapel Hill Tech Program Management Boot Camp and is prepared to cover all phases of the project life cycle and deliver results. This project professional is prepared to execute the project management processes by using the appropriate knowledge area tools and techniques to produce the required project artifacts and move the project towards completion. They also demonstrated proficiency in Agile, Scrum, and Jira.
5d443501-ad81-498b-a7a9-96cd72ff91db.name: Technology Program Management Boot Camp

badge_template_activities.title: Learner has completed the 18-week Tech Program Management Boot Camp from UNC Chapel Hill and scored a B or above in the course. Program includes business of software development, traditional project management, project management in operations, hybrid project management, Agile project management, the Scrum framework, and Jira. Program instructional time is 180 hours, and learners spend up to an additional 180 hours on homework and projects.

dc7f8b62-21f8-40e9-aeff-03ea2df6ed22.description: The badge earner completed participation in the UNC Diplomacy Initiative's Washington Week by engaging in activities and developing knowledge of international policy making, federal affairs, diplomatic missions, and cultural diplomacy. The badge earner enhanced their understanding of global trends, topics, and issues. Students gained familiarity with the global landscape of D.C. and instilled confidence in seeing themselves the role of effective leaders and global problem solvers.
dc7f8b62-21f8-40e9-aeff-03ea2df6ed22.name: Washington Week

badge_template_activities.title: Completed 5-day trip to Washington, D.C. Engaged in organized sessions such as panel discussions, site visits, and learning from foreign affairs practitioners. Participated in pre-trip orientations and career coaching sessions. Completed written or video reflection on experience and how it will shape the student’s worldview. Completed assigned reading/exercise related to experience to prepare for discussion with hosts in Washington. Completed post-trip survey.
